title: What is the double derivative of x^3+y^3-3axy? - Quora

response.answer_text: x^3 + y^3 = 3axy differentiating http://w.r.to x 3x^2 + 3y^2 dy/dx = 3ax dy/dx + 3ay or dy/dx( 3y^2 - 3ax) = 3ay - 3x^2 or dy/dx =( ay - x^2 )/ (y^2 -ax) again differentiating d^2y/dx^2 =[ (y^2 -ax)( ady/dx -2x) - (ay-x^2)( 2ydy/dx- a )] ( y^2 -ax)^2 ) =[ dy/dx[a(y^2-ax) -2y(ay-x^2)]-2x(y^2-ax)+a(ay-x^2)]/(y^2-... d^2y/dx^2=[ {(ay-x^2)/(y^2-ax)}( 2yx^2-a^2x-ay^2) -2xy^2+ax^2+a^2y)]/(y^2-ax)^2
